website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for bakers who want shot glass molds that are specifically designed for cookie dough.
pros: Ideal for making cookie shot glasses
Opens up a world of unique and classy dessert possibilities
Can be coated with chocolate or candy melts for leak-free use with liquids
Non-stick coating allows for easy removal
cons: Getting cookie dough shot glasses just right can have a bit of a learning curve

customer_reviews.title: Good little pan
customer_reviews.text: I got this pan and had good results with the first batch. There's a bit of a learning curve like pushing down the batter evenly & not tilting the inserts. I used my own cookie recipe instead of the one in the box. My only complain is the six slots. It's very time consuming making six cookie shots at a time. A 12 or 18 slot pan would be great. There's a lot of delicious possibilities with this pan. I coated the inside with chocolate & filled them with whipped cream, chocolate mousse, ice cream, & milk. Each one was heavenly.
customer_reviews.author: Stan H. Harada

customer_reviews.title: Mmmm.... Mufffins!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t have time to follow the recipe for chocolate chip cookies from the cookie shot box. So I bought some Betty Crocker cookie mix instead. To bake, I followed the cookie shot instructions to put 2 heaping tablespoons of cookie dough into each cavity. Guess what happened? I got chocolate chip muffins as the dough violently expanded from the cavities. There was essentially not enough space to hold milk after removing my beautiful monstrosities from the mold. I’ll try again with the official cookie recipe later and will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Arnim Zola

customer_reviews.title: Works great because I followed the directions
customer_reviews.text: Read many reviews before trying this product out. Saw a lot of comments that it was impossible to get right but it worked fine for me. I made the recipe specified in the directions, the consistency was a little different than cookies I would normally make (plus it was pretty sticky so I added a handful of flour at the end). It made 3 batches. I sprayed the pan and inserts very thoroughly each batch and pushed the insert back down a little after 8 min (cooked for another 8 after) Out of the 18 shots only one did not work becuase it was just too thin on one part. Good product, does exactly what I hoped
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pan! Accompanying recipe is meh.
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cool idea! I made these and filled them with ice cream and they were a big hit (though of course the ice cream did leak out the bottom a bit.) The only thing I didn't love was that provided recipe calls for quite a bit of flour, which made the flavor a little dull and the texture rather dry. I assume that's in effort to make sure the cookie cups hold their shape. They were still tasty, but I want to try it with a standard dough recipe and see how it works—it might be enough just to bake them a little longer so they're stiffer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine de Richemond

customer_reviews.title: It was a waste of my money
customer_reviews.text: I tried two different batches and failed each time I watched a couple of YouTube videos and tried again and still doesn’t work this was a waste of my money :( yes I use cooking spray Pam so that it would release and it didn’t it would just fall apart and crumble I couldn’t get them out of the pan
customer_reviews.author: Pamzylove

customer_reviews.title: not very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but impossible for the every day baker. The cups are very small and honestly this will not work with store bought dough which means you will have to take even more time mixing dough. I tried with store bought dough and ended up with an over flowing mess all over the oven, uneven walls, and impossible to get out. Id rather take a muffin tin bake cookies and make my own dent in them.
customer_reviews.author: T. P.

customer_reviews.title: A Gift that will put a cute smile on anyone's face
customer_reviews.text: What a cute gift is this????? I made some and took it to work yesterday ,everyone their loved it. Today I made more and blessed my neighbours.....wow ...as soon as they saw it they opened their eyes as wide as it can be....with Joy. Thanks you Wilton and Amazon for helping me to put a Smile on my friend's face. Making other people Happy is a priceless gift......
customer_reviews.author: The bread lady

customer_reviews.title: They really make cups!!!
customer_reviews.text: These cookie cup molds work as advertised. My cookie dough (and I used my own dough recipe) did not stick to the molds. The cookie shot glasses are so cute and tasty. I was worried they would be dry, brittle, stick to the molds, or fall apart. I had none of that. They turned out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A Updike

customer_reviews.title: The pan is obviously good quality and comes with instructions but these cookies obviously ...
customer_reviews.text: The pan is obviously good quality and comes with instructions but these cookies obviously take a much more practiced hand. I followed the instructions exactly and this did not turn out well :(
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Nailed it...not.
customer_reviews.text: You know those Pinterest Nailed It posts? Yep, we should be at the top of the list. I'm not saying I won't try again, but, it's not as simple as the packaging makes it look!
customer_reviews.author: PonyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to make as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time getting this to actually work. I followed the enclosed instructions and recipe to the letter, but couldn't get them to come out like intended.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki G

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use, not great results
customer_reviews.text: In theory this is a great novelty kitchen item. In reality though, more trouble to actually use than it's worth. None of the shot glasses we baked successfully held liquid. The flavor of the recipe was underwhelming. We made one batch and never used it again. I'll probably attempt to sell it on let go or Craigslist.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lowry

customer_reviews.title: These are so amazing! I followed the included recipe and they came ...
customer_reviews.text: These are so amazing! I followed the included recipe and they came out perfectly the first time. Fun to put ice cream in and serve for a special dessert.
customer_reviews.author: Dana S

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. Came sooner than expected. Love it. Exactly how it was described. Now time to bake

customer_reviews.title: Makes it special
customer_reviews.text: Filled with pudding and whipped cream for kids. They loved it. Filled with Kaluha for adults. Lots of fun

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy to use as expected. The tops turned out thin & bottoms thick. Was just ok.

customer_reviews.title: Party Hit!
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this pan! It was a hit at our party. I would recommend using the Wilton recipe for the actual cookie.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Seenauth

customer_reviews.title: Raise and eat your glass.
customer_reviews.text: This is a shot I will gladly drink. So many ideas now for edible drinking containers.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Green

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Followed their recipe exactly, and the cookie dough came out super crumbly. I had to add an extra egg to to bind the ingredients because it was so dry. Not to mention they bake for nearly 20 minutes! Way too long and came out very hard. Save your money! Just bake regular chocolate chip cookies instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My first batch came out perfect. I used my own recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Pamella Ruffhead

customer_reviews.title: Adorable cookie cups!
customer_reviews.text: Time consuming but wow these were the talk of the party! Followed the directions. 10 year old did the molds and did a great job. Buy more than one mold if you plan to make several. Ended up using 3 to get them baked quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K. Mcqueen

customer_reviews.title: I tried a bunch of times to make cookie shots ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried a bunch of times to make cookie shots with these, and even after adjusting the amount of dough I used, I just couldn't get a good-quality cookie shot. I may try again using rice to weigh the molds down.
customer_reviews.author: J Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea
customer_reviews.text: Need to get the right dough mix or they won’t shape correctly

customer_reviews.title: No cookie shot glass for me
customer_reviews.text: I could not get a cookie shot glass to make out of 4 attempts.

customer_reviews.title: Really good product, but it is difficult to fit the ...
customer_reviews.text: Really good product, but it is difficult to fit the inserts in the perfect way to make a pretty cookie.

customer_reviews.title: Stupid
customer_reviews.text: Sure the product is cool but I was trying to give this as a Christmas gift and they decided to slap all the shipping labels right on the box of the item instead of putting it in a box to ship it. So now it looks tacky .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: Love to make cookie glasses for milk for my grandkids..

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase, find another method, possibly mini popover pan
customer_reviews.text: Finished product is not what appears on box/packaging. It is very difficult to get that top edge even, every 'shot' was different height/shape. Dough does rise up and necessary to cut it down during baking. My advice, don't buy it. Find another way to make the 'shots'
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cookie “shoot out all over your oven and explode and not come out of the pan” shooters
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t get it to work. Admittedly not sure if it’s me or the product, but I bake pretty often. Don’t have many epic fails of this magnitude 🤷‍♀️

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My friend loved her birthday gift and tried it out the minute it arrived at her house.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My family and friends all love when I use these. These are a great addition to any kitchen.

customer_reviews.title: I am usually a great baker too
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with any amounts of cookie dough, I cannot figure them out! I am usually a great baker too... These are just not able to form shot glasses like promised

customer_reviews.text: This made the best ice cream cups for my grandsons birthday party!

customer_reviews.text: It didn’t really work the way we wanted to. Maybe try it with mini chocolate chips? They wouldn’t come out in one piece and if they did they would have been lopsided.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Frye

customer_reviews.title: Works great just follow the instructions
customer_reviews.text: I had no problems getting this to work even on my first attempt. I followed the instructions on the box and used the recipe from the package. My husband was impressed and I can't wait to serve them to friends.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: It’s so hard to get them our after they bake without them breaking! And it’s a lot more work than it’s worth.

customer_reviews.title: Useless for my purpose!
customer_reviews.text: Not good for candy treats, not nonstick in that aspect. Waste of money for my purpose

customer_reviews.title: the came out super easy and it was extremely easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: i was a little skeptic after reading the comment but when i finally decided it was perfection!! the came out super easy and it was extremely easy to clean

customer_reviews.title: Needs recipes and suggestions and instructions.
customer_reviews.text: I could not get my chocolate chip cookies to make a shot glass. I finally gave up.

customer_reviews.title: Definatly worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: They are great for a number of ideas, thankyou,very happy with it.

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: A little difficult to use but nice once you figure out how to use it
customer_reviews.author: Allison Pinkney

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the super fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for the super fast delivery! Bought this as a gift for a friend and she's over the moon!
customer_reviews.author: Khushrooshaw Vania

customer_reviews.title: These are so cool and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are so cool and easy to use, my 11 year old son loves to make these, melt chocolate inside and then fill with milk.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a party in the making. Can't wait to give it a try!

customer_reviews.title: interesting. But a bit of a 'fuss and monkey' ...
customer_reviews.text: interesting. But a bit of a 'fuss and monkey' item.
customer_reviews.author: MT shopper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This just didn't work out for me! No matter how much batter I put in, even following the directions the mold just baked right out and I could not figure out how to get it to work! The size of them is small so that even when it did form the sides of the cookies broke completely off removing them! Not sure if it's the batter I'm using or the pans but sadly I didn't get to use them for my sons party! Hopefully next time I can figure out how to get them to look like what the box says they should look like
customer_reviews.author: MrsSpinks2u

customer_reviews.title: The pans work very well, recipe not so great
customer_reviews.text: This Sweet Shooters Cookie Shot Glass Pan Set was a creative idea. The pans work well, they are nonstick and easy to use. The only drawbacks are, the recipe that comes with the set results in somewhat cardboard-y, tasteless shot glasses. No alternate recipes are given, and no filling recipes are given. I realize that one can be creative, and ideas for fillings are given-- ice cream, milk, mousse-- but still, I always appreciate recipes that are specifically designed for the cookware, especially something as unusual as this. And alternate recipes for the cups themselves was really a must. So, 5 stars for the functionality of the set, 3 stars for the recipe, 4 stars all told.
customer_reviews.author: seagull

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: This is the best shot glass mold ever. I have used the silicone ones and they do not work really well. They are very tedious to get out. This is very simple and easy. Put it on the top rack of the dishwasher. I even put cake batter inside the inserts 4 snack size cakes. Be careful not to fill it up too much. I have done cake, cookie ,and chocolate molds in this
customer_reviews.author: Cc

customer_reviews.title: Fun baking tool, but a little hard to find workable cookie recipes.
customer_reviews.text: Great baking tool. Very easy to use after a couple of tries, especially if you use the included recipe. Other recipes have not worked as well yet, but I believe recipes with more butter will work better. We fill these with fruit, whip cream. To keep liquids inside, you have to coat the inside with a candy coating, otherwise expect leaks. We have found that whip cream and fruit are fine without the coating. An excellent product that has lots of possibilities.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Makes fun treats
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I really enjoyed this set to make cookie shot glasses. They were very easy to use and worked well. They thought it was a lot of fun. They only make six at a time so if you want a bunch you'll have to get more than one pan. It did not take too much time to make them. I am glad you could put it in the dishwasher because we don't buy anything that isn't. It is nonstick. It worked as described. It feels well made. I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: B. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Thanks to all the reviews, I followed the recipe ...
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to all the reviews, I followed the recipe, added a bit more dough and carefully inserted the top part in the center. It all worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a great concept! I am famous for my cookies but ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great concept! I am famous for my cookies but sometimes I get tired of just making cookies. This opens a world of opportunity! There are limitless ideas for fillings- you can use a drink, mousse, frosting, fruit...on and on. The pan itself is made with the same quality I have found in other Wilton products. Its well made and easy to use. I will use this a LOT!!!
customer_reviews.author: LOL

customer_reviews.title: ... I have not used it but it arrived in perfect shape thank
customer_reviews.text: Yes I have not used it but it arrived in perfect shape thank you
customer_reviews.author: anita weiss

customer_reviews.title: Just opened it
customer_reviews.text: So far there is a defect in one of the slots, after I make a batch of cookies I will come back and adjust my feedback. And it came very poorly packed. See photo. Ok I made cookies. I greased the cups liberally with cooking spray, and used the recipe provided. They came out pretty cute, I'm happy. But you do have to work with the dough to get it centered and it does take some elbow grease. After I put them in the oven I pushed the inserts back down after 8 minutes. Once they were finished baking I removed the inserts, let the cookies cool and they came out easily. Pic of the finished product added.
customer_reviews.author: Mamawolf

customer_reviews.title: Clever idea and a big hit at parties!
customer_reviews.text: These take some practice. I read other reviews and the included instructions carefully before attempting. Use the included recipe as it's drier than regular chocolate chip cookies - and use mini chips! My first batch was about half usable. The inserts have to be centered and not pushed down too far/hard, then weighted in the oven with a heavier cookie sheet to keep them from rising out. I did better with the second batch and can't wait to try them again. They were the first dessert to disappear at an event I took them to. Some even disappeared before dinner!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Takes some trial and error, but overall is great.
customer_reviews.text: Really love this mold, but it is definitely hard to find the right balance to get the cookies to turn out right. I'm not sure if a standard cookie recipe would work with it or not, we used the recipe from the guy who created the cookie shot. I determined that for that recipe, I actually have to under-fill the mold a little so that the cookie has room to rise without overflowing.
customer_reviews.author: C. White

customer_reviews.title: Will take a few tries to master
customer_reviews.text: Cookies did not turn out very good the first time. Dough raised in oven and had to push plungers down. I also had a lot of cookie I had to trim off. I think after several tries I will get it down pat. Won't fill as full and try different receipt that may not raise
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED USED PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I AM CERTAIN THAT THE PRODUCT I RECEIVED WAS USED!-----GROSS!!!---- First, it was obviously opened and put back together, perhaps a couple of times, the box cover was torn and damaged. Second, many of the reviewers on this site reference a items in their boxes that were not in mine. DISGUSTING!
customer_reviews.author: Charmaine

customer_reviews.title: A Pain  to Store
customer_reviews.text: The pan is really cool and neat. Its fun to make little cookie glasses with treats inside. My issue is storing it though. The mold wont stay inside the pan and can get lost easy and without it the pan would be useless.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Ceballos

customer_reviews.title: Okay for certain dough
customer_reviews.text: Works better with stiffer dough, doesn't really work with store bought dough. I used it with rice crispies, but had to break the cereal up a bit in the food processer to get the insert to form a cup. One you get past that it works.
customer_reviews.author: GLAFY

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an extra in my Xmas Cookie Tins. Worked perfectly - I found a recipe online that was specifically designed for these molds. Easy to get a hang of and great results with the right recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Liz M.

customer_reviews.title: I used any kind of cookie recipe and fill this cup with mousse or pudding The kids love this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the cutest pan I have ever owned. It takes this to another level of baking. I used any kind of cookie recipe and fill this cup with mousse or pudding The kids love this!
customer_reviews.author: Gail MIyagawa

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but I just made my first batch of shot glasses using this pan and it worked better than I expected. I only got 18 out of the recipe, but it was super easy and they all released from the pan without any disasters. I may have to buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: P. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I so enjoy using these in my restaurant; they work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: They worked out perfect. Cookies (cups) were in perfect form.
customer_reviews.author: Picky buyer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I expect the top to be a little heavy to hold the dough but it didn't

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Cookie dough batter spilled up and over during baking when only half full with dough. To late to return so it's sitting in my cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Purchase NY

customer_reviews.title: I have never written a negative review befor this.....
customer_reviews.text: This makes a somewhat edible container. Looks much better than it tastes. Very difficult to get consistant cups. Don't waste good money.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: kind of hard to get usable cookies out of it

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Not sure who did the staging pics for this product ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure who did the staging pics for this product but kudos to them. Couldn't get product out of pan.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Potter

customer_reviews.title: But the product works GREAT and I am planning on buying a 3rd one
customer_reviews.text: Another buy for my daughter... She used store bought cookie dough and make cookie cups, but didn't READ directions, and so put too much dough in. LOL. The cookies expanded out over the top. But the product works GREAT and I am planning on buying a 3rd one! I bought a second one already - for another daughter, who was jealous!! LOL :)
customer_reviews.author: Becca Currie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product
customer_reviews.text: I've never been compatible with appliances like these. I remember buying a cake pop mold, and my cake pop turned crappy. But when I molded my own cake pop, they turned out perfect. So, with this mold, I told myself I'll try it a couple of times and I did. Not once was I successful. It's fairly upsetting how much cookie dough went to waste. I've always liked Wilton products for my baking stuff, but not this one. Don't even get me started with how the product was slightly greasy when I opened it. I told myself, it's washable so whatever. But when this product didn't work, I was like ohhhkaaaay. You're getting sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Karmine

customer_reviews.title: Sweet treats
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this pan. We bought 3 of them so we could cook them faster. They are fun and durable. Can't wait to see what Wilton comes up with next.
customer_reviews.author: RunLikeaDeere

customer_reviews.title: Novel pan with many uses.
customer_reviews.text: I'm the first one to provide popovers after receiving this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Janet M.

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: These were super easy, I can burn water when it comes to baking and I was able to make these easily! I just used the recipe from the Nestlé toll House chocolate chips and make sure your liberal with the baking spray. I found less is more and only went with a 1 inch ball not 1 1/2 inch like the instructions say!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty cool and you can use it for more than ...
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty cool and you can use it for more than what they indicate. Pictures, etc. show or describe it being filled with frosting or cream or melted candies. An excellent way to actually make ice cream cookie cones rather than ice cream cookie sandwiches. Love this and so do my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Serve sweet shooters filled with ice cream
customer_reviews.text: It says: Serve sweet shooters filled with ice cream, milk, mouse and more Mouse? Mouse? Seriously, you want me squashing rodents into these small holes?
customer_reviews.author: Robin Blackburn

product_meta.title: Wilton Cookie Shot Glass, 6-Cavity
product_meta.description: Say 'Cheers' with something sweet. Make cookie shot glasses using this non-stick pan. Just fill the 6 cavities with cookie dough, press the inserts in and bake. After the cookie cups have cooled, coat the inside with your favorite flavor or color of Candy Melts Candy, then fill with mousse, ice cream or milk. Includes one 6 cavity pan with 6 inserts.
feature_bullets: Milk and Cookies are better when you make them with the Cookie Shot Glass Pan Set
Bake 6 edible cookie shot glasses using this 6-cup cookie shot glass pan
Simply coating of Candy Melts candy to seal in drinks and liquid desserts
Serve sweet shooters filled with ice cream, milk, mousse and more
Nonstick 6-cup cookie shot glass pan set is dishwasher safe

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars347 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
